text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

As some of you may know, Kung Fu Panda 3 just
came out and I saw it

and I loved it! And I had to make something
themed!

Throughout the movie, they’re eating a ton
of dumplings, and as you

know, Po the Panda loves dumplings! He wins
dumpling eating contests,

and they looked so good and I thought, let’s
make something savory!

Today we’re gonna be making Kung Fu Panda
Dumplings!
Let’s get started!
Wha!
Skadoosh!

Today we’re gonna be making Chicken Dumplings,
the things you will need,

will be: 2 cups of flour, 1 cup of warm water,
1/2 a teaspoon of sesame oil,

1 teaspoon of soy sauce, a pinch of salt,
an 1/8th of a teaspoon of

ground pepper, 2 stalks of green onions, thinly
sliced, 1/2 a pound of

ground chicken, and 1 clove of garlic, finely
sliced.

And then the tools that you’ll need will
be a bamboo steamer, totally

optional, but some cabbage to steam the dumplings
on top of.
A circle cookie cutter, this 1 is 4 inches.

And then for a dipping sauce we’ve got some
salt, pepper, soy sauce and
sesame oil, now let’s put it all together!
Skadoosh!
The first thing that we’re gonna do, we're gonna combine our warm water with

our flour into a medium sized bowl. And using
a spatula, we’re gonna fold,

mixing it together until the flour is well
mixed.

Now what you’re gonna do, is you’re gonna
take a little bit of flour, sprinkle

it on whatever work surface you’re using,
this is so the dough won’t stick.

Now you’re gonna pour the dough right in
the middle, here we go!

Now we’re gonna knead the dough, with our
hands, for about 3-5 minutes

until it becomes very soft. You’re just
gonna push with the palm, pull it
up over, and push again.

Our dough is nice and smooth, and now I’m
just gonna pick it up and

put it into a clean bowl, right here. And
I’m gonna place a paper towel

over the top, so it’s not fully exposed
to the air.

And we’re gonna set this off to the side
and make our filling.

To make our filling, we are gonna be combining
all of these ingredients,

I am going to be adding them to our chicken, in
this bowl, starting with
my green onion! Come here little onions!
And a little garlic.
Get in there! Oh yeah I want all that garlic!
Get in there! No garlic left behind!
And no green, come on! Yeah!

Now a pinch of salt, I’m gonna be doing
2 pinches because I have very little
fingers. Soy sauce, pepper, and sesame oil!
Oh this smells so good! Oh my goodness!

Now I’m just going to take a spoon, mix
everything together until

it’s well combined. I’m like, starting
to drool!

Da-dew! Now our filling is ready, I’m gonna
pop this into the fridge and

while it’s in the fridge we’re gonna roll
out our dough that we just

made and we’re gonna cut out and make our dumpling
wrappers.

Got my dough, and now we are gonna roll it
out. Again I’m gonna sprinkle
a little bit of flour on the work surface.

Unlike a cookie, we’re gonna be rolling
it very flat. About 1/8th of an inch.

Just use your arm muscles, make it nice and
flat, try to get it as even

as possible. Got our dough rolled out thin
and now we are gonna take
our cookie cutter and cut out a bunch of circles.

Now you’re gonna remove the excess dough
and I’m going to re-roll it so
that we can cut out some more circles!
I want to make as many dumplings as possible.

Because I’m kind of like Po, I love dumplings,
so…
Po can eat 50 at once…
And so can I!

Got all of our circle wrappers cut out, and
now I am going to transfer

them over to a sheet lined with parchment
paper.

I’m just using a little baking sheet over here,
so you’re just gonna pick ‘em up

and ploop! Once you’ve filled up the tray,
you’re just gonna place another

piece of parchment paper on top, and keep
layering ‘em, you can stack ‘em up!

We’ve got our filling, we’ve got our dough
wrappers and now, it’s time
to assemble them!

This part’s really easy! You’re just gonna
take a tablespoon scoop, and

you’re just gonna scoop, I like to like,
pack it in there.

So I’m just gonna place it right in the
center, and scoop it out!

Another helpful tip is you don’t want to
over-fill the filling,

it’s so good, I know! It’s tempting to
put a lot of filling in there.

But you don’t want to over-fill it so that
you’ll be able to close
your dumpling.

Alright, now I’m gonna show you how to close
your little dumplings.

I put it in my left hand, and then with my
right hand I’m gonna make a pinch.

And now using my thumb, I’m gonna press
against my pointer finger, and I’m

making a pleat, just like that. Then you’re
gonna work all the way

around the dumpling. You’re just gonna put
your thumb, pointer finger,

make a pleat, and pinch. Then when you’ve
got it all connected, now you’re

just gonna place it down, and I like to give
it 1 more twist,
all the way around!

And now you’re gonna do this to the rest
of your dumplings.

We’ve got our dumplings made, and now it’s
time to cook them.

We’re gonna take our dumplings, steamer,
cabbage, pot and,

I have a little ring adapter to make my steamer
fit on my pot.

There are different ways to cook dumplings,
you can either boil them

or steam them. Today, I’m going to steam
them!

So we’re gonna take all of these, head over
to the stove!

First we’re gonna fill our pot with about
1 inch of water.

Then we’re gonna turn the stove heat onto
high, place the steamer

ring on top of the pot, and while the water
is heating up, we are going

to line the steamer with cabbage leaves so
that our dumplings don’t stick

to the bottom. You can also use any other
type of lettuce, instead of

the cabbage, just remember to evenly space
the dumplings inside, making
sure you don’t over-fill.

Once the water is boiling, place the steamer
on top of the pot and
steam for about 7 minutes.

Once they’re done cooking, remove from the
heat, take them back over

to the baking station, they are ready to serve,
but we’re gonna make
a dipping sauce.

Over here, our dumplings are cooked, I’m
keeping them in the steamer to

keep them warm, and now we’re gonna make
a dipping sauce.

I’m just gonna make something really simple,
I’m gonna use mostly

soy sauce, so you’re just gonna pour some
soy sauce into this little bowl.

And everyone’s different, they like different
sauces, this is what
I like to do.

Then you’re gonna take a little bit of sesame
oil, just a little bit.

Little bit of salt, little bit of pepper,
and here I’ve got a little baby whisk.
Just gonna whisk it up!
I’ll just take a little taste. Mmm! Yes!

Ta-da! Here are the Kung Fu Panda Dumplings
that we made today!

I hope you guys liked them, this recipe is
so good!

We made home-made chicken dumplings, that
were themed after the movie!
OM-yum-yum-yum-yum-yum-yum!

I’ll be taking lots of pictures of these
and posting them on Instagram,

Twitter, Tumblr, and Facebook! And if you
guys make these, please take

a picture and send it to me! Because I love
seeing your creations!
It just makes my day!

And, if you have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies,

please let me know, leave me a comment down
below and I will do my
best to make it happen!
Alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!

And now the moment I’ve been waiting for,
get to have some dumplings!
And I made so many of these I can make a snack-lace!
Mmmmm!
Mmmm-mmmm-mmmm!
I can see why Po eats 50 of these at a time!
Sometimes I wish I was a panda…
I could eat all day!
